alert.note: Alert for Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 5:44PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN CRAWFORD AND SOUTHWESTERN WASHINGTON COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM CDT... At 544 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northwest of Lee Creek, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Winslow... Chester... Lee Creek... Devils Den State Park... Lake Fort Smith... Strickler... Blackburn... Locke... Odell... Mount Gayler... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 27 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
